3D Printing

Digital Fabrication & Modern Manufacturing

Modern fabrication techniques that bring digital designs into physical reality. From FDM to SLA printing, these projects explore how additive manufacturing can create complex geometries and functional objects that bridge the digital and physical worlds.

Printing Technologies

The diverse 3D printing technologies that enable digital-to-physical creation.

FDM Printing

Fused Deposition Modeling for durable, functional prints using thermoplastic materials.

SLA Printing

Stereolithography for high-resolution, detailed prints with smooth surface finishes.

Design to Print

Complete workflow from digital design to physical object, including optimization and post-processing.

HERITAGE

Litho Legacy Evolution

Born into Canadian lithographic royalty: Son of a legendary print master, ascended to great heights in traditional offset lithography. Then boldly abandoned ink and plates for pixels and polygons. From CMYK to RGB to STL files - the evolution continues.

Printing Philosophy

"3D printing democratizes manufacturing, allowing anyone to transform digital ideas into physical reality with precision and repeatability that was once impossible."

My approach to 3D printing focuses on understanding the unique capabilities and constraints of additive manufacturing. Each project explores how digital design can be optimized for 3D printing, creating objects that leverage the technology's strengths while pushing the boundaries of what's possible.
